text: I didn't think I liked oysters.  I still don't care for raw ones, but the charbroiled ones are dynamite! Their gumbo was great, and boom boom shrimp were very tasty (but were sweet when I expected spicy). The line was down the street (on a Tuesday night) and I can see why.  Even while busy as hell, the staff was friendly and efficient.
Place isn't bad but not to the caliber of some of the other oyster bars, mostly for the tourist.
Other than the charbroiled oysters, ACME is fried seafood. It's seafood and it's fried. Not complicated or anything special. Not sure why it gets so much hype.

I definitely recommend for the oyster patron.  The offerings were fresh and firm not cold and mush.  The staff was extremely busy and yet polite and responsive.  While I would never be able to take on their platter challenge, for you gluttons of pain and pleasure I suggest you give them a try.  Great job ACME.
Generic. Tourist trap. Oysters suck. Not worth waiting in line. Garbage oysters. Go to Frankie and Johnny's or superior seafood or cooter browns before you waste your money on this trash.
The oysters were fresh and good. The service was excellent and fast. We had a big party and they accommodated us very well. I do recommend!!

How does a resturant run out of what they are best known for? After waiting in line for 45 minutes for charbroiled oysters,  we literally got to the door and were told they had run out! !!!  The reason I'm giving a 3 star rating is because upon going back the next day I finally got to have the oysters and they were pretty dang amazing! !!

Always a must stop for us in NOLA. But stick with the oysters raw or charbroiled. Soft shell crab works too. Tommy my son loved it all. We hit it twice this trip. Seafood étouffée was a 2.5 star at best. Will not do that again.

I love Acme! The chargrilled Oysters are to die for. The master shucker Hollywood served us and shucked our raw oysters. We enjoyed beans and rice with our meal. Our drinks were strong and good. I really enjoyed talking to shuckers and they very welcoming. I looked forward to returning to New Orleans and coming back.

Service is great. But after you wait in line, you get oysters that are sandy and gritty. I love oysters, and this place is highly recommended, but I would not eat there. It's the fast food of oysters.
Great service and food roasted oysters were great along with the creole and craw fish etteffe
This was a good visit. Grilled oysters, Boom Boom shrimp. The shrimp and catfish was great. My wife had gumbo and red beans and rice. Waitress was a little slow is the reason for 4 stars.

THE CHARGRILLED OYSTERS omg. Don't make the mistake of only ordering a half dozen. Get the full dozen. They are AMAZING! 

We also got the fried platter with fish and shrimp which was good too, but the oysters were definitely the highlight. Service is amazing as well!
Well since we don't eat Oysters I ordered French fries and my husband had the Seadfood Gumbo and Fried Fish platter.  It was delicious.... he ate all his food and there was plenty!
Awesome oysters and poboys, but a little on the pricey side!

Simply the best in the French quarter. Always a long line at night and well worth the wait. You can not replicate the experience and food any pace on the planet. Go for the wood fired grilled oysters. They are outstanding and often overlooked by the novice raw bar bunny.
The Oyster is good. I also ordered Oyster soup and crawfish tail too salty. And the place is too noise.

Yes to this place!! The best chargrilled oysters. I was a little nervous to try because of the texture but these tasted so good, we should've gotten the dozen. The bread they serve with it is the perfect accompaniment, so don't be afraid to ask for more.
I also got the gumbo and the crab cake. That gumbo was one of the best I've had I literally wanted to bottle it up and take it home. It didn't even have crab in it but it was the roux that made it special. My husband has the peacemaker, which is a fried shrimp and oyster poboy, which is super yummy too and apparently won some awards. My friend got the sampler in which I got to taste the red beans and rice, which was also ah-mazing. I'm so glad I came here, whatever you get you have to at least start with the chargrilled oysters, you won't be disappointed!
Excellent flavoring in the boiled crawfish!!!  My pic shows how many you get with 1 pound.
Simply the best oysters in my opinion.  The atmosphere is fun and authentic to Bourbon Street
Nothing crazy I wasn't impress and and a little overpriced , super crowded , not comfortable and very laud ,hard to carry a conversation in there , food is good but not out of this world .

Pro-tip: get the dozen charbroiled oysters and a side (red beans and rice is DELICIOUS) and you're good to go. Nothing else on the menu was particularly show-stopping, but the the oysters are truly amazing and I would argue probably the best charbroiled oysters in the Quarter.

Acme Oyster House was on my check it out list for New Orleans.  When I made my NOLA plans, I was a little intimidated to find out Mardi Gras is celebrated for a whole month- but aside from "event" pricing and a little longer waiting line it wasn't too bad.  Visited Acme by myself, so I asked for one seat at the bar.  Of course this was the night they turned over tables like crazy.  Groups of two, four, and even six were seated before me!  Ah well.  Finally bellied up to the bar, my bartender recommended the famous char-grilled oysters.  They were a little pricey, so I just ordered 1/2 dozen (also there was a wait for them), soI also ordered a dozen raw oysters and boo fries.
Things were spaced evenly enough that I finished most of the raw oysters and boo fries before the char-grilled ones came.  The boo fries were described as poutine fries with gravy, cheese (in this case cheddar), and roast beef "debris" (scraps).  They were surprisingly good, and provided a nice counterpoint for the seafood.  
The star was the char-grilled oysters!  Sizzling and smelling heavenly, they were a treat on the tongue!  Dripping with melted butter, the char-grilling reminded of opihi on the hibachi.  This was the best item I've eaten in a long time!
With tax and tip, the bill came up to nearly $50.  Definitely an indulgence, but worth experiencing great seafood just off of Bourbon Street in the French Quarter of New Orleans during Madi Grass!  Worth a special trip and highly recommend!

This is our second time here. We had to come back. The charbroiled oysters are freaking amazing. You might as well just start by ordering 2 dozen. The Ettouffe and hush puppies were excellent as well. Finish it off with a banana fosters cheesecake. Stick a fork in me because I'm done.

My wife and two kids had a great meal here. I don't really like the random sitting with people I don't know but that was the only draw back. The chargrilled oysters are a thing of beauty, I could eat a hundred of them. The Po Boys are great also.

I was amazed by how great our experience was! I was with a group of sever people and we waited in line for about 20-30 minutes, which on a rainy afternoon wasn't too bad. There was plenty of shelter and people in line were kind enough to share umbrellas where needed. The hosts could have communicated their wait system with us a bit better though. 
After we were seated the service was excellent!  The chargrilled oysters were AMAZING, we got a few appetizers to split and all enjoyed what we had. We also did a round of oyster shooters, I would not recommend getting these at ACME. In my experience oyster shooters have very little alcohol in them and are more about the different flavors and mixtures, these had a dollop of cocktail sauce in the bottom and oyster and a full shot glass of vodka. Pouring out half the vodka and adding 3 times more cocktail sauce made these doable. A shame an oyster place can't make a palatable oyster shooter. But overall a can't miss when you're in NOLA!

I will be the 100th person to say this on Yelp, but the char grilled oysters are amazing.  I went with a group here and was a little apprehensive due to lines of tourists and neon sign, but the place was fabulous.  Well priced food for the area and again- the char grilled oysters were delicious.  I had some the next day at different restaurant and they were not nearly soo good as at ACME.

Well worth the wait in line! Grab yourself a beer at the bar & come stand outside & people watch. Once inside you MUST order their grilled oysters, quite possibly the best I've ever had. They were cooked to perfection and an order of a dozen was a shareable amount. The truth be known, if my wife wasn't with me I would have eaten the entire dozen.
Oysters were good. Had better night before at Bourbon House. Ambiance at ACME is better but they had pre-mixed cocktail sauce and no mignonette.
Very friendly service, good tasty carb heavy authentic Cajun bar food. Excellent mains and grilled oysters. The only disappointment was the pecan cobbler.

A bit pricey, but was promptly seated on a Saturday afternoon and had an epic meal (the dozen chargrilled oysters and a pint of Abita Restoration) so gooooood! Will return again next time I'm in NOLA.

I'm back despite what I said 2 years ago!!!!  I went with 2 people who had never been before or ever had chargrilled oysters so they were in for a treat.  Surprisingly there was NOT a line!! YESS  Of course I got the oysters and they were fantastic.  I am a fan again but I still wouldn't wait in the line.  My friend came back a few days later, waited in line and got 2 dozen chargrilled oysters!  So yes to acme!

We got an order of the raw and chargrilled oysters. The raw oysters were very fresh and the chargrilled oysters were delicious! We also ordered the boom boom shrimp which were good in flavor but cold. Seems like they would have tasted better warm at least. I ordered a cup of the Chicken/Andouille Gumbo which was delicious as well. Last but not least we ordered the new orleans medley (Sampling of gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and grilled smoked sausage). We decided to get the seafood gumbo since I had already ordered the chicken/andouille. It was ok but i would definatly order the Chicken/Andouille gumbo over the fishy seafood gumbo. The Jambalaya was good buy i still like Felix's jambalaya better. 

The seating seemed a bit unorganized. They sat us at a table where another couple was already sitting at and they had ordered their food as well. The couple came back from the bathroom and got mad at us for sitting there. We tried to explain that we were sat there by the hostess. Needless to say they moved to a different table and the waitresses involved didn't seem one bit surprised. I guess it happens a lot? Anyways I could see the guy complaining to everyone around him about us and he kept pointing at us the entire time. Kinda annoying but people are weird. Just made the visit a little uncomfortable due to the fact that the waitresses didn't seems to care about the mix up.
So worth the wait! Go inside and get drinks to make it feel shorter. My family tried a bunch of dishes that we're all excellent, and the pecan cobbler dessert was a real standout.

Didn't wait even 10 seconds to get a couple seats at the bar. Ordered a couple oyster shooters, those were awesome. The service was great, but confusing. It shouldn't be confusing because you're waiter is standing right in front of you, but it is still different lol. Both of the guys in front of us were awesome, polite and knowledgeable. It was pretty cool watching them chuck the oysters in front of us! 

Also ordered a half dozen of raw oysters, which were awesome, and a fried crawfish tail poboy which was good but lacked a little more flavor and a side (fries maybe?). 

Overall, pretty good and glad I didn't have to wait in the line outside.

Get here early!!!! We arrived at 4ish and was maybe like 4th in line. And when we left there was a line wrapped to the end of the street. It was a packed house but fast pace that people can get seated in no time. 
Like many other yelpers we ordered the chargrilled oysters... delicious!!! The only problem with the oysters was it wasn't cleaned well. Which I expected knowing it a very busy restaurant. The grittiness of the sandy dirt leaves a bad taste. I guess for me wasn't bad. But for the bf, (he isnt really into seafood) 2 was enough for him. Yay! More for me! The bread that came with the chargrilled oyster was a tad bit dry. I'm not sure if it was suppose to be toast or just stale bread. Anyways he ordered the taste of New Orleans platter and everything on it was deliciously good. No complaints there! As for me, since I have been eating all day, I just ordered a crabcake. Not bad there either! No shells in the crabcake just lumps of crabs & breadcrumbs. Overall dining experience wasn't bad. Next time in New Orleans I will try out Draggos & Felix to see who will win for the title of the best chargrilled oysters.

Gluten free red beans & rice AND gluten free jambalaya!! My celiac-self was so thrilled to indulge in a couple classic NOLA dishes -- you know it's rough when so much of the cuisine out here is fried and/or begins with a delicious gluten-filled roux (I WANT TO EAT IT), so having even a few options on the menu is pretty rad. They make it clear on their menu that they don't have a separate cooking space for anything gluten-free, but I personally feel totally fine and really loved my meal.

This place was busy on a Sunday afternoon. There is zero waiting space inside, so poke your head in the door to let the hostess know you'd like a table, then you gotta wait outside. Being a party of one, I only had to wait like 4 minutes. I was seated by the window so I could watch people walk up and down Iberville Street. Always a fan of people-watching. I loved Acme's black and white checkered table cloths, all the neon red lights, and the overall energy. My hostess and waitress were both super sweet and checked on me often, calling me "baby" and "sweetie" and "hon" (as they call everyone). 

They were out of chargrilled oysters during my visit (damn), but the 1/2 dozen oysters on the half shell with lemon and spicy cockail sauce were stellar. Like reaallllly really good. I love a good oyster but am picky with them -- I get easily turned off if they're too gooey, filled with too much liquid, or smell/taste too fishy. These were just right and I probably could have had a dozen alone. I also ordered a side of red beans and rice and a side of jambalaya. Salty with a nice heat, I enjoyed them both. But I totally loved the red beans & rice the most and even ordered a second side of them. Next time I'll get the plate with smoked sausage cause I wanted more more more. 

Also ordered a glass of cabernet for $10, and my experience was about $35 overall (not including tip, but I definitely tipped well)! Seemed totally reasonable for this rad spot between Bourbon Street and Royal Street that always has a line out the door. I thoroughly enjoyed myself at this very New Orleans oyster bar. I'm a proud tourist.

We stayed in line for about 30-40 min... but it was worth it. Half shells was huge and glossy... the chargrilled oysters was BUTTAH, they serve them with bread to dip it in that buttery garlic sauce thing. The seafood etouffee (w/crawfish) was ok, I ordered just a small bowl to taste it. They forgot my wife's order, but whatever we had, and  the oysters was more than enough that we didn't mind. 


*we tried Felix's Restaurant across the street (they have a line as well) they serve great chargrilled oysters too (more charred-taste compared to acme). If you can, try both.

Have to add to the gazillion yelp reviews... Acme lives up to the hype! Gotta come here for charbroiled oysters, something I never had before coming to New Orleans (and I LOVE oysters!) They're oozing with butter and cheese and it just melts in your mouth... so good we came back for dinner another night and ordered 3 dozen for the 3 of us. 

The fresh oysters were some of the best I've ever had - not too salty, nice big size, and paired perfectly with cocktail sauce and horseradish. YUM! 

We tried some other things on the menu, but really... just come for the oysters. Add Acme to your NOLA list, be prepared to wait in line (it goes pretty quickly) and enjoy!

We love this place!  The shrimp po boy and a cold beer will get you where you need to be.  My wife is crazy about the oysters whether they be grilled, fried, or raw!  We highly recommend it one of our favorite New Orleans restaurants!
A New Orleans must!  Oysters are amazing and their Po Boy was the best I had in New Orleans.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

I'm a fan of their chargrilled oysters!!!  
The first time around we waited 10 minutes in a 40 minute wait line and left. The second time around we waited about the same and luckily the bar seats opened and we got seated quickly. The bar tender whose name I can't remember deserves 10 stars. He was welcoming, funny, hardworking and hospitable to everyone. 
We had the chargrilled oysters, fried soft shell crab and shrimp po boy. Next time around I would only order the oysters. They were so good I wanted to lick the shells off...

Fantastic oysters and service. Ask for Garrett to be your server. Our group ordered a dozen of the grilled and a dozen raw paired with some Anita beers. They serve other dishes there too but we went for the oysters only. Enjoy!

Great atmosphere and service, but you got to love oysters. They are fresh and prepared well. You still got to watch out for broken shells and sometimes there is excessive sand but that goes with oysters. Make Shure you get some fresh horseradish as the garlic/mayo/horseradish seems a little old and not very horsey. We also had the étouffée which was great and crab corn bisque which was just ok.  The hush puppies were not special either. 
The wait was not bad for lunch with a party of five on Saturday red dress run day

If you can catch it when the line is minimal or nonexistent, lucky you!  My husband and I managed a couple times while we were in NOLA and it was always great.  We always sat at the bar because it's generally the fastest way to get a table and the people behind the bar are always friendly and interesting to talk to while waiting.  The chargrilled oysters are amazing, can't say enough good things about them!  The boo fries are also soooo good!  Hopefully you'll get lucky and be in New Orleans while Abita Strawberry Harvest is in season and can enjoy that with your meal.  It's the perfect complement to everything they serve.

The bartenders are also really friendly and willing to give recommendations and let you try samples of the drinks before ordering.  I had a taste of some Andygator that I was very grateful that he saved me from ordering because it was way too much for me!
Broiled oysters best ever, po-boy peacemaker very relaxed atmosphere greatt music & staff

Char-grilled oysters are my favorite part of New Orleans! The wait is not that bad because once you get your name down you get called pretty soon after. 

Minus one star for the bread pudding that left much to be desired; it was mushy with little flavor.

Started off my meals in New Orleans here and it was a great way to kick it off.

We hit the place early at around 730 and were seated almost immediately. The place is very uniquely decorated with lots of mirrors and black and white. It's a very relaxed place where you can dig into some oysters and sloppy po boys and fit right in.

We had some grilled oysters. My first time for it, what a genius dish for people who don't go raw. The oysters still tasted like oysters and the cheese and butter go down nicely with an Abita. I shared a sloppy roast beef 10 napkin sandwich with a friend. It was pretty delish. I'd recommend adding some hot sauce. The jambalay and gumbo were alright. The Peacemaker po boy will also take care of your fried oyster and shrimp needs in one shot. 

Our waiter was friendly and attentive. Someone thought he looked like LL Cool J.

Can't go wrong here. Go in as you are and leave satisfied. It was pretty cheap for New Orleans French Quarter.

Was inline for at least 30mins to be seated. 

Service in general isn't that great; luckily our server was nice. 

The raw oyster taste that great; but the chargrilled oysters was really good. We ended up getting another order of them

I personally don't understand how this place got 4 stars. We had to wait in line (only about 10 minutes) but the guys outside were really friendly and made it go by quickly. The service was overall good, but it was the food I had an issue with. If I could, I would give them a 2.5/5. 

The oysters we ordered were burnt and didn't seemed to be cleaned properly because there was sand within each bite. They were also a bit overcooked so we were really unimpressed. 

We also got the Grilled Sausage Po Boy and Crab Bisque combo and Crab Cakes. The po boy itself a bland and mediocre. I really wish we didn't even bother ordering it. The soup, on the other hand, was flavorful and quite delicious! The crab cakes were also really tasty, but looked like it was fried in week old oil. 

I feel like there are such great restaurants around here and when I return, I probably won't return.
The alligator bites are delish and the service is always fantastic. Looking forward to returning.
A must if you're in NOLA!! Thank you Marlon for the great service. Oysters and seafood sampler were off the hook.

The jambalaya is amazing with the bread! We randomly selected this restaurant in the French quarter and the food was great. However I do feel as though the alligator appetizer was too little to share amongst a party of four but it tasted great. I would definitely visit again!

Great place to eat! And, they're open until 1 a.m. I had the Jazzy Crab Cake platter and a side of red beans and rice.  My friends had everything from the ribs to the seafood platter.  The service was excellent.  The staff was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. One friend ordered the Hulk and she loved it!  It's also right off of Bourbon Street and a four minute walk from our hotel on Canal Street. I would definitely recommend this place when visiting NOLA.

Great food, great service in the French quarter.....

My wife and I had just arrived in town and we were looking for good food and drink while watching the Super Bowl.....

One of our people recommended this spot so we decided to drop by....,

My wife had the sampler which consisted of red beans and rice, jambalaya and crawfish etoufee....
I had the reddish etoufee which was absolutely the best redfish I've ever had!!!!

My wife had the hurricane which was equally as good, and topped it off with the Oceana brownie which is one of the best deserts we've had in a long time... 

Great experience!!!!

Check it out if you're in town......
Pretty good food. The prices are high but the food is good. Perfectly fried oysters and a great smooth Bloody Mary. Has outside patio seating
I eat here every time I'm in NOLA and I always get the crab cakes appetizer. It's delicious every time. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the poor service.

My friend and I both had the chef's special. (Blackened red fish over jambalaya with mushroom, crawfish sauce and greens on the side.) YUM! One of the  best meals we had this entire trip. The service was excellent. Our servers name is David and he was clean personable entertaining and knowledgeable. Best server we've had in New Orleans. We actually ended up coming here twice on our trip because we liked it so much. You guys should just eat here. OK?
Good stuff...oh my...low expectations.....good results....again...oh my...ordered the special suggested by waiter....great fish..good sides...solid good choice....Get in..Get out..Enjoy

The best dinner option in NOLA. Period. The service is also superb! Ask for David if you go! 

We arrived slightly before the normal dining hour, and when we left the line was around the block!!! This place is that amazing! We are so pleased that we found Oceana - kudos to Yelp! for that! 

David recommended that we start with the Oysters Oceana, since the restaurant is known for their sauces, and hummmm diggity those things are goooooodddddd. They were so tasty that we ordered another platter of them. I don't even care for oysters really, but I had to sample them. Man... they were so good! They are baked and are bathed in a delicious, creamy sauce. Included on the plate are a few slices of french banquette. Dip one of those babies in the sauce, and your tastebuds with be on Cloud 9. I dream of having that dish again. Truly I do. I literally wanted to lick that plate clean, but since I'm a classy broad I had to refrain. 

Next up, five dishes in total: Two orders of Gumbo, crab cake fettuccini, blackened chicken fettuccini, and crab cakes with greens and potatoes. Everyone was very pleased with their menu choices, and cleaned their plates. Compliments over and over again to the Chef. 

Lastly, dessert was up. Bananas Foster was the choice, and it was a remake of the original. This one was more of a bananas foster ice cream cake. Cool creamy vanilla with banana on top of a sweet buttery crust, and all topped with whipped cream. Delectable. 

This was such a lovely dinner. The ambiance, the service, and food were five stars all around. This will be my first stop for dinner next time I happen to be in New Orleans. It should be yours too.

We came here for a late lunch. Luckily we were seated right away. We ordered fried shrimp platter and Mardi Gras pasta. Mardi Gras pasta was good but not great. Fried shrimp platter was disappointing. The batter was too thick, not seasoned. Shrimps were not fresh either. Overall, I won't recommend this overrated restaurant especially when there is a plenty of good restaurants in the area.
Yummy lunch. Alligator bites & crab cakes were great! Definitely a good place to stop for lunch.

We visited at around 11am on a Sunday and there were no crowds. I've noticed that there were long lines in the evenings. The Uber driver recommended this place as one of his favorites. It was a nice place, but expensive for a group of 5. Kids meals were pretty pricey for what we received. Everything was delicious though. We tried the alligator sausage (first time eating sausage) and it was delectable.
I thought the food was good. I do think they put too much sauce on the charbroiled oysters, although the sauce does taste good. The poboy was ok but the bread was too dry. The atmosphere was great!

This is always my go-to when I come to New Orleans. The food is always amazing. The staff is so much fun! We had the fried loaded with fried alligator and they were amazing. We were in town for our honeymoon and the manager treated us to cheesecake. The tropical storm drink was yummy too! Always a must when in NOLA!

We were so excited to mark Oceana off our to eat lost in New Orleans. What a huge disappointment. First off we came for oysters and dinner. After sitting on a slow night we ordered a dozen oysters and 2 meals (ribeye and crab cakes) waited a long time to even get our drinks and next thing we knew our meals were out. We never ever got our oysters the waiter simply said he forgot. Did not offer to correct at all. My steak was entirely Fat. Now I like some fat on my steaks but it was inedible. The waiter asked if was ok I let him know the issue and we never saw him again except to drop off our bill. We paid but will never ever visit again. Did not fix anything and did not even get our order. Very very disappointed.
Ordered the New Orleans sampler and the flavors were excellent. I'd recommend this place over another highly rated restaurant that appeared on Triple D. Well worth a try.

The food was fantastic! I got the crab cakes and they were SO GOOD. The crawfish sauce was super spicy for my wimpy taste buds, but that was a theme during the entire trip to NOLA, not just Oceana.
The eggplant sticks on the appetizer menu was also pretty amazing. Interesting atmosphere, lovely architecture and friendly staff.

We had some of the most delicious food at this location! We got Grilled Alligator bites, Oysters, Mardi Gras Pasta,  and a sampler called "The Taste of New Orleans." Everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection! This was one of the best restaurants in New Orleans we've tried. And our server Latricia was amazing! She was fast, efficient, and always checked up on us. Not to mention her great personality and recommendations. She definitely attributed to our visit! If my best friend and I are ever in New Orleans, we will definitely return!

THE BEST OYSTERS ONE MAY EVER HAVE (Oceana's Famous Dozen) We come to New Orleans from Texas a couple of times a year just to have their food! We always get the Taste of New Orleans or Red Beans and Rice or their Crab Cake Fettuccine Alfredo with our Oysters and you can't go wrong with any of their dishes! We are in New Orleans for three nights and have/will eat dinner there every night!

Went here with a group of 13 people. Had to wait a little while as it was busy but they accomadated us well and we even got a table upstairs. The service was great. Our server was named Chad and he did a great job of getting orders right and the food came out in decent time. Would highly recommend the seafood platter, the catfish was wonderful as was the creme brulee. Would definitely go again.

I was craving a bowl of gumbo and some crawfish etouffee and this place hit the spot! I placed a delivery order and the food came packaged tight and was still hot! Very important when ordering delivery. Alot of other restaurants miss that mark. 

Perfect for Netflix and lounging. The gumbo was so good I actually came back the next day with friends and sat in the patio. The staff was extremely hospitable and friendly. The restaurant itself was so busy but I had absolutely no complaints both visits. Get the pecan pie if you have room for dessert.

Stopped in for lunch.  Blackened Alligator tail was fantastic, followed by blackened Ahi Tuna stuffed with a crab cake and Shrimp Remoulade!  Wow what a dish!  Ezra our server was fantastic.  Definitely worth stopping in!

We enjoyed the fried platter of indulgence and red fish with crawfish gravy. The gravy was good, the fish was a little dry. The fries oysters were amazing along with the catfish and shrimp. The batter was thin and crispy, just the way I like it. Definitely worth a stop in NOLA.

We came here strictly on reviews , wasn't as expected at all. Presentation for the restaurant in itself was amazing however service and food have been something more to desire on reviews than in person. Rice was cold when delivered , had to eat appetizer with our entree for mistaken order. Food was a 6/10.

We decided to stop for lunch. The restaurant is located right off our Bourbon Street. 

All of the staff at the restaurant was extremely friendly, including our server, Lakeisha. I ordered the hurricane cocktail, which was mixed well. We were also impressed by how quickly the food came out.

We started with the gator bites appetizer - half fried and half blackened. My husband enjoyed them. This was my first time having gator bites so I have no comparison, but it will say the blackened was way better than the fried.

For entrees, my husband ordered the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo. While he enjoyed the meal and said the Alfredo had good flavor, the sauce was a bit runny and it definitely wasn't presented with jumbo gulf shrimp. The shrimp were on the small side. I had the Taste of New Orleans (pictured), which was creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, red beans and rice with smoked sausage. Was it the most authentic dish in the world, probably not. But it had good flavors. However, I was disappointed that it only came with a half a piece of sausage (the sausage was delicious!).

At the suggestion of family members who ate here a few months earlier I decided to patronize this restaurant while visiting NO.  
The  food is ok contrary to the rave reviews posted on Yelp. 
I had the crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes were warm although the plate it was served on was extremely hot. 
My friend ordered the gumbo at the suggestion of the waitress. Gumbo was a huge disappointment. Gumbo was not eaten. 
For the entree I ordered the crawfish étouffée with fried crawfish tails. Again the food was served warm and there was an odd taste. Most of this dish was uneaten. 
Truly disappointing meal.

So delicious! I'm a California native, but I love NOLA and heard Oceana was a place I had to try. Crab cakes was amazing and the pasta was too. Only bad thing is I asked for more Alfredo sauce and the waiter said ok, but never brought it:(

Oceana was a great place to host a dinner with colleagues. Service was amazing, food was tasty and drinks were delish.
Sierra our waitress was the best!!!! Everyone commented on her quality of service.
Will come again!
Incredible service at the bar. The jambalaya pasta (blackened, per my servers recommendation) was one of the best things I ate in New Orleans.

The building itself is really cool and we came  here based on the recommendation from the hotel. The line was down the block and moved fairly quickly -about a 20 min wait. The weather was nice so that was fine. We got seated upstairs and Kevin our waiter came over after about 10 min and wanted to take just our drink order but we were ready to order so we ordered 2 margaritas, oysters, and two entrees the shrimp creole and the catfish. After another 15 min we got our water and another 10 min after that we got our oysters, then got the the margaritas. Unacceptable to have the two drinks come after the appetizer. The oysters were awesome and we should of just ordered those. He never came back to check on us and Someone else brought the entrees. The catfish was good but the creole was not. It was like a ketchup based rice bowl with no flavor. Combined with the poor service and bland entrees I won't come back.
Great food, pasta was fresh and food came out quick. Staff was friendly and the place seemed pretty clean. Oh yeah and their margaritas are good!

Sooo good. I had the jambalaya pasta with the gator sausage and shrimp in it and it was pretty good. My friends had the gumbo (tastes just like my family's, FABULOUS) and the crab cakes which were also good. I can't wait to go again in about five weeks (for Essence Fest!) and try many more dishes. But I'm definitely sticking with the gumbo!

Was really skeptical of a restaurant near bourbon street but this was great! Every single employee was so dang friendly and wonderful. The oyster po boy was excellent, the bread being the best part actually. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. Also had the collard greens which were so flavorful. Also loved the purple haze beer which had a bit of a raspberry flavor to it. Would definitely go again next time I'm in NOLA.

Went in for lunch on my recent stay in New Orleans. Loved the food here! The crabcakes were absolutely amazing, tried the fried oyster platter for lunch, was also excellent! The service was great and the ambiance was truly Louisiana! Definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for some good Cajun seafood!

Mmmm, if the plates were any smaller for the appetizers, they could have used doll house sizes and really saved.  Look, if you are going to charge those prices for such a small serving, then you should get knocked a bit.....wasn't a good value. The flavor was good on all servings.  Preparation was very average.

Had breakfast and dinner here while we were in New Orleans and both were great. Prices are about average for restaurants in the quarter. The food was great and the staff was super friendly. The shrimp and alligator bite PoBoys are awesome. We made reservations and they seated us right away even though we were 30 minutes early. Definitely would recommend eating here.

Had the Fried Oysters and a salad. The salad was just ok, but the oysters were yummy.  Friends had the Po Boy.  THEY said it was scrumptious but I thought the bread was a teeny bit dry. 

The service was excellent and the best thing was the bread pudding

First off, the waitstaff were ALL just about the best we encountered in our 4 days in NOLA.  Our server, Jordan A, was excellent!  She was pleasant, fun, helpful, and just made us feel right "at home."  She helped us navigate the menu and made a couple of recommendations.  We ended up with an oyster po-boy and a catfish plate.  Both were wonderful and more food than we could handle.  Our only regret is that we didn't find Oceana, and Jordan A, earlier in our visit!
Man o man this place da boooomb!! First time in NOLA and it is great . Food at this place insanely delicious !!!

Came on a sunday afternoon around 1pm and there was no wait. Fast friendly service, and the food was really good! Keeping in mind i was so hung over (not a good town to be hungover in) and still enjoyed the meal! We had the blackened duck and blackened red fish, both were big portions. Good bang for your buck!

I tried this restaurant on a recommendation. There was a line to enter, but it moved quickly. I ordered the blackened duck and it was excellent. The person I was dining with ordered the blackened redfish which was also excellent. The experience was very good and I recommend this restaurant highly.

I did the research, I wanted to try gumbo while in town and I wanted to try the best. And that is how I ended up at Oceana Grill!
It starts off great wandering the French Quarter to get there! The restaurant has an inside and an outside patio. It was a beatific day, so I picked the patio. Make sure to look around the place is so cool full of interesting decoration & paintings. 
I came here for the Seafood gumbo - $5.50 a cup, $9.50 a bowl. I'm typically not a soup person, but I knew I had to try gumbo while in town. This is a stew and it's thickened with rice, okra & veggies. The flavored are so out of this world amazing. It had a hint of spice but not overly spicy, hello Cajun creole influences! The seafood tasted so fresh! 
I was so happy OG introduced me to the amazing world of gumbo! Excellent way to start my NOLA vacation!
To note, I came here twice while in town. Yes, it was that good!

Delicious fooooood! Went here twice. Red beans & rice and the OceanA's signature oysters are on point! 

From one huge foodie to you! Eat it!!

Great food, great atmosphere and friendly wait staff! Warning, there can be a very long wait for this restaurant depending on the time of day you go. I waited about 25 minutes and the line was out the door. 

I have also ordered in through uber eats from here and it was very quick and food was delicious. I would recommend to try their fried seafood platter. Delicious! Price is reasonable as well.
We had breakfast. Had a great menu from elaborate omelettes to simple side dishes. Perfect for all. The staff was very attentive and the food excellent. Bloody Mary's are the best in the quarter.

The raw oysters were a little chewy and overall, not the greatest.  They were big, that's good, but not slide down the throat, that's bad.  They weren't very flavorful, that's bad, but I was drunk, that's good.  I would go somewhere else for raw oysters.

This place was on Kitchen Nightmares but we didn't have any nightmares.. the staff were very friendly, the food was really good. Reasonable prices(poboys $11-15) and big portions! It was extremely cold in the restaurant that's why the lack of the fifth star.

What an awesome eating experience. We had Oysters on the half shell, a few beers and then for the main course we had Redfish Ponchatrain. The main course was so delicious with the crawfish and jalapeño cornbread. Desirie was spot on as waitress and took very good care of us. We make it to New Orleans at least annually and I highly recommend this restaurant.
Love the food here. Bayou pasta was amazing. I love the service; waiter was very nice and gave some really good recommendations. Char grilled oysters were ok.
